basics.name: Redji Jean Baptiste
basics.label: Student
basics.description: I am a Co-operative education student at Algonquin College in the Computer Systems Technician - Networking (1560X03FWO) program. I'm learning network administration, cybersecurity fundamentals, system configuration, and IT infrastructure management. My goal is to build a career in IT, focusing on protecting digital assets and implementing secure network solutions.

work.summary: Planning to build open-source governance tools for DAOs and decentralized communities
highlights: Designing quadratic voting mechanisms for community decision-making
Planning treasury management modules for transparent capital allocation
Researching conflict resolution systems for decentralized protocols

work.summary: Currently working on open-source tools for ensuring responsible AI development
highlights: Developing bias detection algorithms for large language models
Creating ethical guidelines and templates for responsible AI deployment
Building explainability tools to make complex AI systems more transparent

work.summary: Starting development on an open learning platform for blockchain and Web3 technologies
highlights: Planning interactive tutorials on smart contract development and security
Designing automated testing frameworks for hands-on learning experiences
Creating comprehensive documentation resources for new Web3 developers

interests.name: Blue-Team Security Operations
interests.description: Building resilient detection pipelines and hands-on incident-response playbooks for enterprise and small networks.

interests.name: Network Automation & Infrastructure-as-Code
interests.description: Eliminating manual toil by codifying network configs with Python, Ansible, and Terraform.

interests.name: Zero-Trust / SASE Architectures
interests.description: Designing identity-centric, segmented networks for hybrid-cloud environments in line with NIST 800-207.

interests.name: Cloud & Container Security
interests.description: Hardening AWS, Azure, and Kubernetes workloads from build to runtime with DevSecOps practices.

interests.name: Open-Source Governance & Digital Sovereignty
interests.description: Empowering nations like Haiti through transparent, community-owned software and "public-money, public-code" principles.

interests.name: Decentralized Mesh Networking
interests.description: Building community-run, disaster-tolerant networks that blend LoRa, Wi-Fi, and P2P routing.

interests.name: Blockchain & Web3 Security
interests.description: Auditing smart contracts and safeguarding on-chain assets, DAOs, and emerging token economies.

interests.name: AI for Cyber Defense
interests.description: Leveraging machine learning to automate threat hunting, anomaly detection, and phishing prevention.

projects.name: Subnet Designer & Visualizer
projects.description: Python tool that calculates VLSM subnet schemes and produces a LAN topology diagram. Reinforces OSI/TCP-IP knowledge and IPv4 addressing from CST 8182.

projects.name: Windows 11 Secure Build Guide
projects.description: Hardened Windows 11 VM with local GPOs, NTFS permissions and PowerShell scripts for automated baseline deployment. Mirrors skills from CST 8202.

projects.name: Linux Essentials Lab Book
projects.description: GitHub repo of step-by-step Bash labs that cover user/group management, file permissions and shell-scripting automation—direct output of CST 8207.

projects.name: Interactive Number-System Converter
projects.description: CLI program that converts binary ↔ decimal ↔ hex and demonstrates Boolean logic routines learned in MAT 8002 and CST 8324.

projects.name: Blue-Team Home SOC
projects.description: pfSense firewall + Suricata IDS feeding Elastic SIEM with Slack alerts; capstone for upcoming Security+ and CyberOps studies.

publications.name: Blockchain for Economic Development
publications.summary: This research explores how blockchain technologies can drive economic development in underserved communities by creating transparent financial systems and reducing barriers to access.

publications.name: Decentralized Finance in Emerging Markets
publications.summary: An analysis of how DeFi solutions can bridge financial inclusion gaps in emerging markets, with case studies from Caribbean and African economies.

publications.name: AI Applications in Economic Forecasting
publications.summary: Examining how artificial intelligence can improve economic forecasting in developing economies with limited historical data and rapidly changing conditions.

publications.name: Financial Inclusion Through Digital Assets
publications.summary: This paper explores how digital assets can extend financial services to the unbanked and create new economic opportunities in underserved regions.

publications.name: Governance Models for Digital Economies
publications.summary: A comparative analysis of governance structures for digital economies, focusing on DAOs and their potential to revolutionize community-driven decision making.
